title: Marinated Red Onion Condiment (Cebolla Curtida)
ingredients: 1 large red onion, at least 4 inches in diameter
1 habanero chile; or, you may use a chile serrano
instructions: Cut the onion lengthwise in half; then slice it across the grain into thick ¼-inch slices.  Put the slices in a strainer and wash all the slices 2 or 3 times with cold water, to ensure mildness.  Using paper towels pat all the onion slices completely dry.
Place the onion slice in a glass bowl and pour the vinegar and salt over the onion slices.  Mix everything gently.

Toast the habanero chile (or Serrano chili) on a comal and put it in the middle of the bowl – the habanero is not for eating but to spread its flavor and spiciness to the onions and to add a little color decoration to the dish.
Remarks:  Cebolla curtida can be served as a relish with just about anything grilled; or with baked meats, tacos, and tortas.
Source:  A Cook’s Tour of Mexico by Nancy Zaslavsky, published by St. Martin’s Press, New York, New York, © 1995 by Nancy Zaslavsky.
